p.s: Hello, my name is Faraj al-Byarshan.
I'm 41, aan engineer and iI immigrated to New York from Iraq in 2005.
I'm happy to be here now, but it was a very hard way to get, where I am now.
My wife and my two sons followed me two years later, in 2007.
I was very scared, they wouldn't make it but I'm really proud of them.
We emigrated because in our country were much poevretypoverty, school exclusions and criminality.
I wanted a better life for my kids and earn money.
To be here is very nice but often we get in contact with racism.
I think people will always look at us differendifferent, just because we are black.
But I'm very happy to be here after such a long journey.
I was always scared that my kids and my wife get killed and I couldn't protect them.
Now we can lifelive in peace and freedom.
My children are going to school and I earn money so I can say we got a nice life.
Sure, we miss our home country at some way'sways, but it's also very hard to get okay with the flashbacks you get, when for example somebody got shooted infrontin front of your eyes.
I think, now in New York we found our place and get a savesafe life.
